attributes.action: Force insurers to cap prices at 15% of the value of the vehicle
attributes.additional_details: Any attempts to get an insurance quote for a newly passed 17yo driver on a cheap car, Vauxhall Corsa, Volkswagen Polo, etc, will result in quotes of £5000+, even with a black box. This is unacceptable.
attributes.background: As of today (30/10/2023) there are no laws or regulations regarding the pricing of vehicle insurance, allowing insurers to get away with increasing prices by insane amounts. Government needs to force insurers to cap prices to 15% of the vehicles value. Paying £3k/year on a £1200 car is extortion.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Establish a Commission to investigate extortionate Car Insurance price rises: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/644067

Place a Cap on Motor Insurance Premium Increases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/649918

Introduce fixed prices for car insurance based on power to weight ratio and age: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/646793
